Description:
SummaryThe Banquet Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of banquet operations within the hotel. This includes planning, organizing, and directing all banquet functions and staff and ensuring high customer service. The Banquet Manager must be able to anticipate the needs of customers, ensure quality services, and successfully manage banquet functions from start to finish. The Banquet Manager must be highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. It is also essential to have strong communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with other departments. The successful Banquet Manager will be able to confidently and accurately respond to customer inquiries and complaints while ensuring all guests have a memorable experience. The Banquet Manager must understand food and beverage services, health and safety standards, and current hospitality industry trends. It is also important to be able to effectively manage and motivate staff, troubleshoot issues, and work within budgetary guidelines.DutiesOrganize and oversee banqueting events
Develop menus and coordinate catering staff
Handle bookings and customer inquiries
Plan seating arrangements
Prepare event documentation
Ensure health and safety regulations are met
Train and supervise banquet staff
Monitor event budgets
Conduct quality control
Ensure excellent customer serviceRequirementsProvide exceptional customer service

Monitor event progress and supervise staff
Liaise with caterers, decorators, and other suppliers
Manage event bookings and payments
Develop and monitor banquet budgets
Keep records and generate reportsSkills
